front.title: YANG Data Model for Segment Routing

abstract.t: This document defines a YANG data model for segment routing configuration and operation. This YANG model is intended to be used on network elements to configure or operate segment routing.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines a YANG data model for segment routing configuration and operation.

section.title: Design of the Data Model
section.t: The organization of this module and protocol modules have to be discussed.

section.title: Configuration
section.t: This module augments the "/rt:routing/rt:routing-instance:" with a segment-routing container. This container defines all the configuration parameters related to segment-routing for this particular routing-instance.
The segment-routing configuration is split in global configuration and interface configuration.

The global configuration defines :
segment-routing transport type : the standard model supports only MPLS as segment-routing dataplane. The transport-type is defined only once for a particular routing-instance and is agnostic to the control plane used. Only a single transport-type is supported now. bindings : defines how external informations may be advertised as a segment ID. The current version supports the mapping-server where static bindings can be defined (prefix to SID bindings). Configuration of bindings does not allow advertisement of those bindings. Advertisement must be controlled by each controlplane. SRGB (Segment Routing Global Block) : defines a list of label blocks defined as pair of lower-bound/upper-bound where the node will pick up for Prefix-SID. The SRGB is also agnostic to the controlplane to be used. So all controlplanes will have to advertise the same SRGB.

The interface configuration defines :
Adjacency SID properties Prefix SID properties

section.title: Adjacency SID properties
section.t: In case of parallel IP links between routers, an additional Adjacency SID may be advertised for each parallel adjacency with a common value. The "authorize-bundle" configuration defines if operator wants to enable such behavior.

The "advertise-protection" defines how protection of an interface should be advertised. It does not control the activation or deactivation of the protection. If "single" option is used, a single Adj-SID will be added to the interface. If the interface is protected, the B flag of the adjacency will reflect this state. If "dual" option is used and if the interface is protected, two adjacency segments will be associated with the adjacencies present on the interface. One Adj-SID will always have B unset, the other will have B set. This option is intended to be used in case of traffic engineering where a path must use protected segments or non protected segments.

section.title: Prefix SID properties
section.t: An interface may own IP prefixes. By default, no prefix SID will be advertised for any IP prefix owned by the interface.
When adding "prefix-sid" in the interface configuration, the operator can control the advertisement of a prefix SID.
The operator can control advertisement of prefix SID independently for IPv4 and IPv6. Operator is required to set a prefix-sid value.

The value can be expressed as an index (default), or an absolute value. Operator can also control if the node flag must be set for the prefix. As the router owns the prefix, the default value is to advertise node flag as set.
The last-hop-behavior commands the PHP behavior : explicit-null, php or non php.

section.title: Control plane configuration
section.t: Activation of segment-routing extensions for a particular control plane is done by augmenting routing-protocol configuration with segment-routing.
The "enabled" leaf permits to active advertisement of segment-routing extensions within the routing protocol.
The "binding" container defines the ability for the routing protocol to advertise or receive bindings.
This model supports ISIS () and OSPF as controlplane ( and ) for segment-routing.

section.title: States
section.t: The operational states currently contains information about usage of allocated label blocks.
It also provides information on global SID bindings. A list of all globally allocated SIDs is provided associated with information about the binding.

section.title: Notifications
section.t:
The model proposes two notifications for segment-routing.
segment-routing-global-sid-collision : must be raised when a new learning through controlplane has an index which is already associated with another target. segment-routing-index-out-of-range : must be raised when a new learning through controlplane has an index which is outside the SRGB configured on the node.
